content.description:
This route follows the obvious bolt line between Return to Hell and Existence Denied.

The route starts in the middle of the formation and climbs up to a shelf. From the shelf the first bolt can be clipped. An interesting oppositional move to two solid flake jugs progresses to the second bolt. Clip the second bolt and attempt the crux. After the crux, proceed up for a few moves, and then clip the 3rd bolt. Traverse right and clip the last bolt.

This route shares the bolted anchor with Existence Denied to the right.

Note - this route can be top roped best after leading Return to Hell from the routes two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Between

Return to Hell

and

Existence Denied

.

content.description: Return to Hell is pumpy, delicate and sustained - a real quality route for the grade.  Start on the southeast arete of the Gate Keeper.  Work up and right through a series of taxing maneuvers, traversing several times below the bolts.  There seems to be no one crux as the climb is very sustained, although I had the most difficulty moving up after the second traverse; the most improbable move is perhaps that final move to gain the anchor.  Rappel to descend.

This one lies on the far right side of the Gate Keeper.  Start up over easy flakes to stand in the large dish at its right side.  If you are tall enough you can clip the first bolt from here.  Move up and right, around the dish.  Traverse back to the left, above the dish; this requires a shift in balance on some very interesting holds.  Continue up over the negative headwall on small edges.  Like its counterpart on the left side of this face, Existence Denied finishes with a very difficult move to gain the anchor.  Rappel to descend.
